note_text: OPERATIVE NARRATIVE: The patient, Mr. McNeil, presented for staging of a PET-avid left upper lobe mass. Following induction of general anesthesia and placement of an 8.5 mm endotracheal tube, a systematic endobronchial ultrasound examination was conducted. We identified and sampled stations 4R, 4L, 7, and 10L. Rapid On-Site Evaluation (ROSE) indicated malignancy in stations 4R and 7, while stations 4L and 10L yielded adequate lymphocytes without definitive malignant cells. The procedure concluded without complication, and the patient was transferred to the PACU in stable condition.

Procedure: EBUS-TBNA
Attending: Dr. Kim

note_text: OPERATIVE REPORT: Ms. Rivera, a 59-year-old female with a PET-avid RUL nodule, underwent robotic-assisted navigational bronchoscopy. The Monarch platform was utilized to navigate to the posterior segment of the right upper lobe. Radial endobronchial ultrasound (R-EBUS) confirmed a concentric, solid lesion. Transbronchial sampling including forceps biopsy, needle aspiration, and cytology brushing was performed. There was no evidence of pneumothorax or significant hemorrhage.

note_text:
PROCEDURE: Rigid therapeutic bronchoscopy with tumor destruction and tracheal stenting.
INDICATION: 73-year-old male with severe airway obstruction due to squamous cell carcinoma.
DESCRIPTION: The rigid tracheobronchoscope was introduced. Significant fungating tumor was noted in the mid-trachea. Mechanical debulking was performed using the bevel of the scope and forceps, followed by APC for hemostasis and tumor ablation. A 16 x 50 mm Dumon silicone stent was deployed, covering the lesion and restoring airway patency.

note_text: Mr. Caldwell underwent rigid bronchoscopy to relieve his tracheal obstruction. We identified the squamous cell carcinoma narrowing the mid-trachea. We mechanically removed the bulk of the tumor and used APC to control bleeding and destroy residual tissue. To prevent re-obstruction, we placed a straight silicone stent. The airway is now widely patent, and he was extubated immediately following the procedure.

Post-procedure imaging ordered.

note_text:
Proc: EBUS (4R, 7, 11R) + EM Nav (RLL mass).
Findings:
- EBUS: 4R/7 malignant.
- Nav: Tool in lesion, fluoroscopy confirmed.
- Bx: 5 samples RLL mass.
Comp: None.
Plan: Oncology referral.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Right lower lobe lung mass with PET-avid mediastinal/hilar lymphadenopathy; combined staging and diagnosis.
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Malignant adenopathy at 4R/7; parenchymal biopsy pending.

evidence.ebus: EBUS-TBNA of stations 4R, 7, and 11R with malignant cells at 4R and 7 on ROSE.
evidence.navigation: Electromagnetic navigation with superDimension system to RLL lesion.
evidence.tblb: Five transbronchial biopsies obtained from the RLL mass.

registry_entry.ebus_rose_result: Adequate - malignant at 4R and 7; benign lymphocytes at 11R.

changes: Validated CPT codes [32560] against IP_Registry and ip_coding_billing.v2_7.
Clarified pleurodesis via existing catheter without new tunneled catheter and added coding_review with RVUs for 32560.

rows.description: Bronchoscopy with EBUS-guided sampling, initial mediastinal/hilar station(s).
Bronchoscopy with EBUS-guided sampling, each additional station.
Bronchoscopy with computer-assisted/navigational guidance to peripheral lesion.
Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy, single lobe.

notes: Combined EBUS staging and navigational bronchoscopy RVUs derived from bronchoscopy tables in ip_coding_billing.v2_7.
Total payment estimate does not account for multiple procedure reductions at the payer level.

rules_applied.description: Diagnostic bronchoscopy (31622) and basic TBLB (31623) are bundled when more advanced EBUS and navigational sampling is performed.
Radial EBUS (31654) is not reported here because it is not documented; only EM navigation and fluoroscopy were used.
Moderate sedation codes 99152/+99153 are not billed when general anesthesia is provided by anesthesia service.

narrative: 31652 is selected for initial EBUS-TBNA stations (4R, 7, 11R) with malignant ROSE at 4R and 7.
31653 is appended for sampling additional nodal stations beyond the first.
31627 and 31628 capture EM navigation and transbronchial lung biopsies of the RLL mass.
No separate diagnostic bronchoscopy or basic TBLB codes are billed, and moderate sedation codes are excluded due to use of general anesthesia.

note_level_rationale: EBUS of 3 stations (4R, 7, 11R) maps to 31653. 31652 (1-2 stations) was removed.
Navigation and TBLB codes retained.

note_text:
OPERATIVE REPORT: Combined EBUS-TBNA and electromagnetic navigational bronchoscopy. 
INDICATION: Staging and diagnosis for 71F with RLL mass and adenopathy.
EBUS: Stations 4R, 7, and 11R sampled. Malignancy confirmed at 4R/7.
NAVIGATION: The superDimension system was used to navigate to the RLL basilar segment lesion. Transbronchial biopsies were obtained under fluoroscopic guidance. 
CONCLUSION: Stage IIIA/B lung cancer (N2 disease).
